message: It's a kid thing. Everything in moderation, including gaming. That they treat it as a crime is rather silly I think. That the child is obsessed with it most likely means that there's something big missing in his life. What kind of person will that experience mold?

Remarkable, the indigenous Africans in their native Egypt with cradles of civilisation over 10,000 years ago along the African River Nile - language, writing, science, engineering & culture. And most importantly the associated social engineering to achieve civilisation whilst most of the rest of the world were eking out a living as barbaric nomadic hunters & gatherers. Alien incursions & invasions starting with the Italian Roman Natives, Persian Natives, Arab Natives, & Western European Natives have all but destroyed the nucleus of civilization & the once great Native Africans.

Eric, its not necessarily the fact that this child is praying to God that restores faith in humanity. Its about the selfless actions of this little boy, who chose to ask for a miracle for someone else instead of a toy for himself. Even those who don't believe in God, or have a different god can appreciate this selfless act and see it as having faith in humanity.
